summary: Internal FBI Victim Services Division email from Amanda Allen informing field victim specialists of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest in New Hampshire on July 2, 2020, and outlining the charges against her. The email provides guidance on handling potential contact from victims of the original Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Amanda L. Allen
persons.role: FBI Program Manager, Victim Services Division
persons.context: Author of the email, informing FBI victim specialists of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest and providing guidance on handling victim communications.

persons.name: Amanda N. Young
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email, asked to approve the draft message for distribution to victim specialists in the field.

persons.name: Angela Jackson
persons.role: Lead Victim Specialist on the Maxwell case
persons.context: Copied on the email; identified as the lead victim specialist for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, to whom questions from field specialists should be directed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the arrest made by NY Division in Manchester, NH; indicted on charges including enticement of a minor, conspiracy, transportation, and perjury related to Jeffrey Epstein's activities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the original charges; his victims may be impacted by the news of Maxwell's arrest.

connections.description: Maxwell is arrested on charges related to Epstein's criminal sexual activity with minors, indicating an alleged conspiracy between them.
Both are FBI Victim Services Division employees coordinating on the Maxwell case response; Allen directs questions to Jackson as the lead.
Jackson is the lead victim specialist on the Maxwell case, handling victim communications related to the investigation.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: FBI NY Division arrested Ghislaine Maxwell in Manchester, New Hampshire, early in the morning.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A true bill (indictment) was returned in New York City charging Maxwell with enticement of a minor, conspiracy, transportation for criminal sexual activity, and perjury.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI in Manchester, New Hampshire, on July 2, 2020.
Maxwell was indicted on June 29, 2020, on federal charges including enticement of a minor, conspiracy, transportation of a minor for criminal sexual activity, and two counts of perjury.
The FBI Victim Services Division anticipated that victims from the original Jeffrey Epstein case would have strong emotional reactions to Maxwell's arrest and might contact the FBI.
The indictment identifies specific victims, but their names are redacted in this document (shown as bullet points).
The investigation was active at the time of the email, and FBI personnel were instructed to only repeat information from official statements by SDNY and FBI NY.
